songs.title: Confusion
songs.lyrics: Stuck in a maze, a labyrinth of hate. Shattered doors in<endline>A mask of haze. Struggling madly in a cage. Desperately<endline>Searching for a way out of the maze. Running blindly not<endline>Feeling the floor, nothing to stand on we fall. Lost in<endline>The halls, I'm looking for the doors. Confusion! My<endline>Senses are dying. My soul is crying. Let me out, let me<endline>Out! I'm screaming! Running blindly through the visions<endline>Barefoot and defenseless. Running blindly through the<endline>Dark, infested woods. Time and time again. Disillusion<endline>I'm deeper in the maze. Further from the light. I scream<endline>Out of the confusion. I'm being consumed by confusion. My<endline><endline>World has been shattered. Crippled. All we have left is<endline>Fragments of doors. Though we once had but never had<endline>We've all been fooled. Confusion. My senses are dying my<endline>Soul is crying. Let me out. Let me out. I'm screaming<endline>I'm living in a demented labyrinth. tortured. Lost<endline>Crippled. I'm a part of this confusion. Shattered<endline>Confusion. Shattered vision. All that I have left is<endline>Illusion. I'm screaming at the confusion. I'm being<endline>Consumed by confusion. In an abstract, in a world of<endline>Confusion!

songs.title: Deep Fried Frenz
songs.lyrics: As you call 'em, they call you when they need something<endline>Trees for the blunt, the G's for the front<endline>I found a way to get peace of mind for years and left the hell alone<endline>Turn a deaf ear to the cellular phone<endline>Send me a letter or better, we could see each other in real life<endline>Just so you could feel me like a steel knife<endline>At least so you could see the white of they eyes<endline>Bright with surprise, once they finish spitting lies<endline>Asssociates, is your boys, your girls, bitches, niggas, homies<endline>Close, but really don't know me<endline>Mom, dad, comrade, peeps, brothers, sisters, duns, dunnies<endline>Some come around when they need some money<endline>Others make us laugh like the Sunday funnies<endline>Fam be around whether you paid or bummy<endline>You could either ignore this advice or take it from me<endline>Be too nice and people take you for a dummy<endline>So nowadays he ain't so friendly<endline>Actually they wouldn’t have made a worthy enemy<endline>Read the signs: "No feeding the baboon"<endline>Seein' as how they got ya back bleeding from the stab wounds<endline>Y'all know the dance, they smile in ya face, y'all know the glance<endline>Try to put 'em on, they blow the chance<endline>Never let your so-called mans know your plans<endline>(How many of us have them?) A show of hands<endline>(Friends) is a term some people use loosely<endline>I'm real choosy on what I choose to let crews see<endline>You telling me; I try to act broke<endline>Jealousy the number one killer among black folk<endline>Fellas be under some type of spell like crack smoke<endline>Ghetto Cinderellas, lead 'em right to your stack, loc<endline>Just another way a chick'll lead to your end<endline>I check the dictionary for the meaning of friend<endline>It said: person, one who likes to socialize with<endline>Sympathiser, helper, and that's about the size of it<endline>Most of the time these attributes is one-sided<endline>To bolster the crime, they're apt to shoot you through your eyelid<endline>And they can't hide it, going wild like a white bitch<endline>Sometimes ya need to cut niggas off like a light switch<endline>(Click!) And when things get quiet<endline>Catch 'em like a thief in the night, what a riot<endline>I first met Mr. Fantastik at a arms deal<endline>Don't let it get drastic, think of how your moms'll feel<endline>When it get for real, steel get to sparkin'<endline>Everything darken, and ain't no talkin'<endline>For somethin so cheap, it sure buys a lot of trouble<endline>Ya better off focusing than tryin to plot to bubble<endline>Or else it'd be a sad note to end on, the guns we got is<endline>(One's we can depend on, friends)<endline>Some come in the form of codependence<endline>A lot of times only end up being codefendants<endline>Ten bucks say they tell for a lower sentence<endline>And leave you up under the jail, begging for a penance<endline>It don't make no sense, what happened to the loyalty?<endline>Honor amongst crooks, trust amongst royalty<endline>I'd rather go out in a blaze, than give 'em the glory<endline>(How many of us have--) a similar story<endline>(Friends) before lovers, we used to have some type of over-standing<endline>Just so when I let her get the man thing, she know it's no strings<endline>We could do the damn thing, but ho, it's no rings<endline>Just how the tramp swings<endline>Will she see 'em again?<endline>That depends on how good was the skins and could she memorize the lessons<endline>It ain't no need to pretend<endline>Even though she let 'em stab it, she know they're just friends<endline><endline>

Khan<endline>As the funky beat continues, a rock steady<endline>We have got to try to find Doom!<endline>Good luck!<endline>Time to get the feta!

songs.title: Go with the Flow
songs.lyrics: Big up all the Monsta Island massive<endline>And beware before I triple dare you like the last kid<endline>Who asked me what we don't got that you got son<endline>For one flow that's elementary, my dear Watson<endline>Secondly, ever since I was little<endline>Not so much to riddle, least rhyme to the syllable<endline>Keep tracks that make a Arab thief clap<endline>With no hands, I chopped these drums off, truly yours, G Rap<endline>Actual fact, relax<endline>In this land of lyrical lost, black, I'm not the cool sleestak<endline>The one who might stop and talk to you<endline>Poisoned a few, niggas who be biting styles I'm like pork too<endline>Ooh, what you got to lose? Let mud fly<endline>When I got blues I chew whole crews that's bud dry<endline>So I ask why the styes from the cess<endline>Shit be fucking with my eye as I pull it to the chest<endline>The super motherfucking villain grip the mic with an iron hand<endline>Throwing MCs to the fire from out the frying pan<endline>It ain't no use in trying, man, son stop crying<endline>Fronting like you death-defying, you need to stop lying<endline>Speak your piece only once you're spoken to first<endline>Now let me hear your verse while I'm choking you<endline>With well refined rhymes like a editor<endline>Throw them to my collections of skulls and spines like Predator<endline>Fuck around, the only niggas who could hear the same sound (Who?) was Jet Jaguar and James Brown<endline>(yeah yeah, only them two)<endline>Ain't you glad I took the time to write their names down to big 'em up (True, true)<endline>I'd like to say, "Hi, it's Sci.Fly the odd Merlin"<endline>That's quick to whip up a script like Rod Serling<endline>Who eye on bad bitch who used to whip the Sterling<endline>Who see God toke but never see God hurlin'<endline>My man Grimm had his little monkey like Space Ghost<endline>Me myself I got flavors that out-taste most<endline>With numb gums, some rhymers is lactose<endline>Back to you MF DOOM, you late show host<endline>S to the U to the P E R-uh<endline>Who chronicle these times in a 3D horror<endline>Thriller porno co-starrer in a realer drama<endline>Who break bread with stingy kin-men, indian borrower<endline>Lone gunman who candidly flip fly flows<endline>Single-handedly with one eye closed<endline>In a fly pose, no shirt Alayé<endline>May see me stack the quarter-mill cash pay<endline>That's that n a smash way how he did it<endline>Motherfucker probably couldn't peep it past a minute<endline>Exquisite scripts, that quick shit, go with flow<endline>That's how we do it though

songs.title: MF DOOM’s Mask Through The Ages (Feature)
songs.lyrics: Zev Love X (1988 ~ 1993)Villain's first step into the spotlight was under his nickname 'Zev Love X' at the age of 17. He was part of the group KMD with his younger brother (DJ Subroc)  and third member Rodan, who was later replaced by Onyx the Birthstone Kid. After his brother DJ Subroc's death and the group was dropped from their label, DOOM went off the grid for half a decade.<endline><endline>During his time with KMD DOOM didn't wear anything to hide his face from the public. Unless you count cap and his glasses of course...<endline>Pre-MF DOOM (1997 ~ 1999)"Dumile began freestyling incognito at open-mic events at the Nuyorican Poets Café in Manhattan, obscuring his face by putting a women's stocking over his head."<endline>- Wikipedia<endline>Before even picking up the identity of MF DOOM, Dumile had already made the decision to cover up his face when he returned to the hip-hop scene. The quote above states he was wearing women's stockings over his face while 'KEO', who worked with DOOM on his first 2 masks, has stated he also wore a bandana over his face to conceal his identity. No real pictures of this era are spread publicly.<endline>Prototype DOOM mask (1999)Worn in videoclips from the 'Operation: Doomsday' album; for instance in '?'  & 'Dead Bent'<endline><endline>Dumile took on the identity of MF DOOM, based of Marvel villain Doctor Doom, and started with wearing a 'real' mask instead of stockings or a bandana.<endline><endline>"He cleans his metal mask with gasoline"<endline>- MF DOOM on '?'<endline>By the time DOOM spitted the line above, his mask wasn't even made of real metal yet. It was still just a plastic altered WWF Kane mask, also known as 'prototype'. Cleaning his mask with gasoline is for that reason probably not a good idea.<endline><endline>Extra: Make your own MF DOOM prototype mask! ✂️<endline>Original DOOM mask (2000 ~ 2004)Worn on the album cover of Madvillainy, also in the music video's for this project and is the base for all further iterations.<endline>"We went out and found the whole helmet from the movie 'Gladiator'"<endline>~ Blake 'KEO' Lethem<endline>The first real iteration where the mask was made out of metal. This was made shortly after Operation: Doomsday as he was seen wearing this during his performances at this point in time.<endline><endline>This mask, which is basically just the face plate from a dissmantled roman helmet replica from the movie 'Gladiator' enriched with construction helmet webbing, is considered to be the face of MF DOOM ever since.<endline>Original DOOM mask + Side spikes (2005 ~ 2010)Started to appear around the time DOOM collaborated with Danger Mouse as DANGERDOOM.<endline><endline>In 2004 DOOM was still seen with his original mask; for instance on the cover of 'Madvillainy'. 2005 was the year his album 'The Mouse and the Mask' came out. Even though the mask illustrated on the cover of this album doesn't have any side spikes, there are in fact pictures of the duo DANGERDOOM with these on the side of his face.<endline><endline>The overal aesthetics of the mask are identical to the original mask; only there are now two spikes located on each temperol bone.<endline>Original DOOM mask + Jewel & Side spikes (2011 ~ 2014)Can be seen in the music videos for his collaboration with Jneiro Jarel, where he appears as part of JJ DOOM. Also worn during the RedBull Music academy interview which took place in Madrid, 2011.<endline><endline>It basically is identical to the original mask with the side spikes, The biggest change however is that this mask has a small mostly red jewel in between the eyebrow area. On some occassions the jewel was seen in other colors, for instance cyan blue. It also looks more chrome-ish since the mask reflects more light than the others normally did.<endline>Golden DOOM mask (May 2014)First appeared in an announcement video DOOM made for 'Check the Rhyme' festival in France where he had a show.<endline><endline>This mask was the first iteration which changed the primary color of it, being gold instead of metallic/silver. Another unique detail about this mask is that appart from the earlier described masks there is a color difference in the hardware; The side spikes are still the chrome/silverish color while the rest of the mask is in fact gold.<endline><endline>Nehruvian DOOM mask (Oktober 2014)Started to appear around the time DOOM formed the duo NehruvianDoom with Bishop Nehru.<endline><endline>While wearing the golden mask on the NehruvianDoom album artwork, DOOM has been seen sporting a transparent red mask around Bishop Nehru. the same color difference, just like on the gold one, between the spikes and the rest of the mask is also featured on this iteration. A new unique feature which isn't been spotted on other variants but does appear on the Nehruvian DOOM mask is that the jewel inbetween the eyes seems to be missing, even though the socket for the jewel is there.

songs.lyrics: There's only one beer left<endline>Rappers screaming all in our ears like we're deaf<endline>Tempt me, do a number on the label<endline>Eat up all they emcees and drink 'em under the table<endline>Like, "It's on me—put it on my tab, kid"<endline>However you get there, foot it, cab it, iron horse it<endline>You're leaving on your face, forfeit<endline>I crush the mic, hold it like the heat, he might toss it<endline>Told him tell her they stole it, he told her he lost it<endline>She told him, "Get off it," and a bunch of other more shit<endline>Getting money, DT's be getting no new leads<endline>It's like he eating watermelon, stay spitting new seeds<endline>It's the weed, give me some of what he drooping off<endline>Soon as he wake up, choking like it was whooping cough<endline>They group been soft<endline>First hour at the open bar and they're trooping off<endline>He went to go laugh and get some head by the side road<endline>She asked him autograph her derriere, read<endline>"To Wide Load, this yard bird taste like fried toad turd<endline>Love, Villain." Take pride in code words<endline>Crooked eye mold nerd geek with a cold heart<endline>Probably still be speaking in rhymes as an old fart<endline>Study how to eat to die by the pizza guy<endline>No he's not too fly to skeet in a skeezer eye<endline>And squeeze her thigh, maybe give her curves a feel<endline>The same way she feel it when he flow with nerves of steel<endline>They call the super when they need their back, uhh, plumbing fixed<endline>"How's  there only one left? The pack comes in six!<endline>Whatever happened to two and three?"<endline>A herb tried to slide with four and five and got caught like, "What you doing G?<endline>Don't make me have to get cutting like truancy<endline>Matter fact, not for nothing, right now, you and me!"<endline>Looser than a pair of Adidas<endline>I hope you brought your spare tweeters, MC's sound like cheerleaders<endline>Rapping and dancing like Red Head Kingpin<endline>DOOM came do his thing again, no matter who be blingin'<endline>He do it for the smelly hubbies<endline>Seeds know what time it is like it's time for Teletubbies<endline>Few can do it, even fewer can sell it<endline>Take it from the dude who wear a mask like a 'tarded helmet<endline>He plots shows like robberies<endline>In and out, one, two, three, no bodies, please<endline>Run the cash and you won't get a wet sweatshirt<endline>The mic is the shotty: nobody move, nobody get hurt<endline>Bring heat like your boy done gone to war<endline>He came in the door, and "Everybody on the floor!"<endline>A whole string of jobs like we on tour<endline>Every night on the score, coming to your corner store<endline><endline>

songs.title: Operation: Greenbacks
songs.lyrics: [King Ghidra]<endline>A fly tramp, that's what she called me<endline>Cause I don't wear no Stetson hats like Paul C<endline>As y'all see, who give a fuck? Who know what is it?<endline>These styles will be flipped to the absolute exquisite<endline>It's like a blizzard, soon as I got home from ATL<endline>Looked into my baby's face, my boo was like ... "Well!<endline>I know your types of clientele! Thoughts, needs"<endline>As I held her firmly, yet gentle as the soft sea<endline>She said, "The one with the horse weave? The pretty one?<endline>All crazy, had to touch the tattoo through the short sleeve<endline>Which one you want?" I'm like, "If there was comp?<endline>Fuck around, a nigga like me probably run up in all three!"<endline>King Geedorah what they call me, either caesar or baldy<endline>Probably have moved since last y'all saw me<endline>On the D-low, I slaughter solo emcees, they paper-thin<endline>In they Polo, Nautica, or DK men<endline><endline>Amen! It's funny how significance make a difference<endline>Notice parables of three in every other inference<endline>For instance: "Who wanna battle? On the real?<endline>Choose your weapon: microphone, beats, or the wheels-of-steel"<endline>I own a crown in all three for getting down without a doubt<endline>I'd like to give a extra special out to Jet Jaguar, the sun, moon and star<endline>The Monster Island Czars - y'all know who you are<endline>Get that!<endline><endline>[Megalon]<endline>Coming straight from the black lungs<endline>I rip tracks for all players that pack guns<endline>Stack ones in packs, done and doing back-to-back runs<endline>To my peeps that close, so's ya' knows what's up<endline>Y'all know the dough's quick, hoes that mess with 5-O shrimp like, "What?"<endline>Like they wanna shmoosh us, just to packing the pushers<endline>I'm packing gat then bust a cap at po-po<endline>If they catch us and try to push us<endline>Since when a MINY nigga don't be taking no shit?<endline>I be that drug dealing nigga that be fucking ya' bitch!<endline><endline>[King Ghidra]<endline>What a fella! Like Salt, Pepa, Spinderella<endline>I came to spark the deaf, dumb and blind like Helen Keller<endline>If I'm not with George of the Jungle, if he not with Stella<endline>Or either Priscilla, I'm doing dips on Godzilla<endline>Though y'all know he don't play, right?<endline>TNT throws a nigga out a moving van in broad daylight<endline>And he was shackled by hands and feet<endline>Then they say he tried to escape, once his face scraped the concrete<endline>Near the curb on Monster Island, 103 Street<endline>Where brothers run the risk of getting swallowed once the Beast eat<endline>I'd rather lay in the cut, collect cash pay<endline>Only TNT I see is Gilligan's castaway<endline>With Mary Jane and Ginger<endline>Oh, from which you spent the night by accident, I creep like a ninja<endline>When the mack is bent, who can give one fuck?<endline>Get bucked, get broke up like three-piece nun-chucks<endline>Y'all sun struck, sick to they head-piece<endline>Three-headed beast brings the drama to a dead cease<endline><endline>(Get that money, god)<endline><endline>Sick to they head-piece<endline>(Get that money, god)<endline><endline>(Get that money, god)<endline><endline>(Get that money, god)<endline><endline>Greenbacks ... the meanest green stacks<endline><endline>

Worthless to say<endline>(And the lights went down and hey!)<endline><endline>It's like a mosquito, the much sweeter resent the act<endline>I been bent back since my Physical went back<endline>Since, Cultured more of my kin<endline>And for them I keep an L rolled in this hellhole<endline>Hold your head, use your head and hold, or be dead and cold<endline>In the worsest way, soon as the leaves show red and gold<endline>To 'round Nimrod release day<endline>And all else? songs.title: REIGN.. IN THE SUBWAY
songs.lyrics: No friendly warfare, this ain't wrestlin'<endline>There's nothin' staged over here, you're trippin' Mescaline<endline>Drinkin', coulda got smacked for what he thinkin'<endline>Coulda said the word, then whack! Abe Lincoln<endline>And still spend stacks off crack, stay crinklin'<endline>This game's built to get got while blinkin'<endline>Rappers do big up jail like a recruiter<endline>Let 'em tend ta hit a boy, said he was a shooter<endline>Told him "Man up, or keep it pushin' like a scooter"<endline>Then said nuttin' and didn't pass the Buddha<endline>Lo and behold, police shows up<endline>Spit his shitty sixteen and got his self froze up, up<endline>His story had a moral, it's buried in the soil<endline>Vil put it in her back like the epidural<endline>Kids: eat, sleep, stay away from creeps<endline>Spit it from the heart, this game's for keeps<endline>So peep<endline>Yeah, saga of a true B-Boy<endline>Beware any likenesses or imagery is a decoy<endline>Sho nuff, yo fluff, force like Bruce Leroy<endline>Bring trouble up and get double cut— keloid<endline>Bubble up, run 'em up, destroy<endline>And anything else you see— void<endline>Rightful ownership<endline>Got a bone to pick with the phoniest colonialist<endline>Who own a ship<endline>The loneliest known to rip<endline>Known to sip pine and ripple<endline>Find yourself in a bind and pickle<endline>Don't bite the hand that feeds you, bite the nipple<endline>In this land of black and brown, ain't no backin' down<endline>As foul as that sound, it's hard to find a cap and gown<endline>But it's always like a MAC around<endline>B-r-r-r-r-at!! Man down<endline>Metal is empowered, devil is a coward<endline>It all smells of high hell like no one ever showered<endline>Scrub behind ya ears, shed the final tears<endline>Remember what the world was like in the final years<endline>Just a speck of dirt in the universe, snap fingers<endline>Just like that— assume the worst<endline>Back in business, guzzle beers, track and fitness<endline>Laps get faster, could've missed Christmas<endline>What is this?

songs.title: Rhymes Like Dimes
songs.lyrics: Joking rhymes, like the "Is you just happy to see me?" trick<endline>Classical slapstick rappers need Chapstick<endline>A lot of 'em sound like they in a talent show<endline>So I give 'em something to remember like the Alamo<endline>Tally-ho! "Really? Thanks!"<endline>To the gone and lost forever like "Oh My Darling Clementine"<endline>He hold his heart when he telling rhyme<endline>When it's his time, I hope his soul go to Heaven<endline>He nasty like the old time Old No. 7<endline>You still taste it when you chase it with the Coca-Cola<endline>Make 'em wish they could erase it out the Motorola<endline>I told her, "No credit for a bag<endline>If you want what they got, then go get it, it's all gack"<endline>Only in America could you find a way to earn a healthy buck<endline>And still keep your attitude on self-destruct<endline><endline>Joking rhymes, like the "Is you just happy to see me?" trick<endline>Classical slapstick rappers need Chapstick<endline>A lot of 'em sound like they in a talent show<endline>So I give 'em something to remember like the Alamo<endline>Tally-ho! A high Joker like a Spades game<endline>Came back from five years laying and stayed the same<endline>Saying, "Electromagnetic feeling blocks all logical, Spock"<endline>And G-Shocks her biological clock<endline>When I hit it, slit her to the shitter,  thought I killed her goose<endline>Her Power U was pure Brita water, filtered juice<endline>Keep a pen like a fiend keep a pipe with him<endline>Gentleman who lent a pen to a friend who write with him<endline>Never seen the shit again but he's still my dunny<endline>The only thing that come between us is krill and money<endline><endline>

songs.lyrics: She wondered would it hurt again, a scary new setting<endline>A Mary Lou Retton perfect 10 -- was it worth it then?<endline>Would have made the clique switch way back<endline>For a quick pitch in the haystack<endline>With a bad bitch like Payback with interest<endline>Used to keep her nice coo trimless<endline>Flipped it for a high school gymnast<endline>She was thicker than the kick off "Supersonic"<endline>Sicker than the bubonic, to Vik it was platonic<endline>Wow, found a new playmate<endline>At this late stage in the game he couldn't get the name straight<endline>Told her "it was all up in your calf muscle"<endline>Showed her how to pull it off, all laugh and tussle<endline>At one point she thought he was a lame cat, with game for the rats<endline>A dog to claim the blame at<endline>Told her "Maybe it's your momma fault, for giving you the shaker"<endline>Summi-summi-somersault<endline><endline>Butterflies at the very mention<endline>The flutter of her eyelashes help to clear the tension<endline>Then went and tripped and fell head over heels<endline>V, and got dirtier than Red Rover's wheels<endline>No matter how high-stake the price<endline>This good-luck charm on his arm shake the dice<endline>It's gymnastics, practice makes nice<endline>She's not the type to be enticed by fake ice<endline>Aah -- the stench of first love<endline>The quench of the thirst made it worse<endline>Truly the burst of upper-thrust motion<endline>Trust, devotion<endline>Lust is like the sand where the beach meets the ocean<endline>Soaking, felt joy in the whirlwind<endline>Never ever did he ever mention boyfriend/girlfriend<endline>Demanded her respect<endline>Then ran and did a handspring, almost landed on her neck<endline><endline>

Yeah, he'll come out in it, but he's not gonna get money.<endline>[Robot Voice]<endline>Notify MF, KMD, GYP, CM. Effective Immediately<endline><endline>[Raymond 'Zoro']<endline>Yeah, but that's true, what he said, man. I don't, I don't want my pictures in the papers<endline><endline>[Phade]<endline>Look, man, I know how the publicity machine works. You're gonna get cash money for this. You might not get the money, like, right now, but you gon' have money like Barry White, man! You can do all kind of crazy shit you wanna do when you get this publicity, man.<endline>[Robot Voice]<endline>Top Secret Ultra End Of Message<endline>Um<endline>Huh<endline><endline>[Otto Von Lenz]<endline>Now, who will be the first to tell me of a past adventure?<endline><endline>[MF DOOM]<endline>I ain’t sayin’ nothing<endline><endline>[Reed]<endline>Why don’t you tell him about the time we faced Doom?<endline><endline>[Sue]<endline>Alright.
